root_text.title: Matrix of Triads
root_text.author: Bhikkhu Sujato
root_text.text:
• Compendium of Phenomena

1.1. Matrix of Triads

SC 1Ms 29Dhs_1Homage to the Blessed One, the Perfected One, the Fully Awakened Buddha.

1.1.1. The “skilful” triad

SC 2 Ms 29Dhs_2Msdiv 1Phenomena that are skilful.

SC 3Ms 29Dhs_3Phenomena that are unskilful.

SC 4Ms 29Dhs_4Phenomena that are undesignated.

1.1.2. The “feelings” triad

SC 5Ms 29Dhs_5Msdiv 2Phenomena associated with pleasant feelings.

SC 6Ms 29Dhs_6Phenomena associated with painful feelings.

SC 7Ms 29Dhs_7Phenomena associated with neutral feelings.

1.1.3. The “result” triad

SC 8Ms 29Dhs_8Msdiv 3Phenomena that are results.

SC 9Ms 29Dhs_9Phenomena that are liable to be affected by results.

SC 10Ms 29Dhs_10Phenomena that are neither results nor liable to be affected by results.

1.1.4. The “what has been grasped” triad

SC 11Ms 29Dhs_11Msdiv 4Phenomena that have been grasped and are liable to be affected by grasping.

SC 12Ms 29Dhs_12Phenomena that have not been grasped but are liable to be affected by grasping.

SC 13Ms 29Dhs_13Phenomena that have neither been grasped nor are liable to be affected by grasping.

1.1.5. The “defiled” triad

SC 14Ms 29Dhs_14Msdiv 5Phenomena that are defiled and are liable to be affected by defilement.

SC 15Ms 29Dhs_15Phenomena that are not defiled but are liable to be affected by defilement.

SC 16Ms 29Dhs_16Phenomena that are neither defiled nor are liable to be affected by defilement.

1.1.6. The “initial application of mind” triad

SC 17Ms 29Dhs_17Msdiv 6Phenomena that are with initial and sustained application.

SC 18Ms 29Dhs_18Phenomena that are without initial and with only sustained application.

SC 19Ms 29Dhs_19Phenomena that are with neither initial nor sustained application.

1.1.7. The “rapture” triad

SC 20Ms 29Dhs_20Msdiv 7Phenomena that are imbued with rapture.

SC 21Ms 29Dhs_21Phenomena that are imbued with pleasure.

SC 22Ms 29Dhs_22Phenomena that are imbued with equanimity.

1.1.8. Triad to be abandoned by seeing

SC 23Ms 29Dhs_23Msdiv 8Phenomena to be abandoned by seeing.

SC 24Ms 29Dhs_24Phenomena to be abandoned by developing.

SC 25Ms 29Dhs_25Phenomena to be abandoned neither by seeing nor by developing.

1.1.9. Triad with roots to be abandoned by seeing

SC 26Ms 29Dhs_26Msdiv 9Phenomena whose root is to be abandoned by seeing.

SC 27Ms 29Dhs_27Phenomena whose root is to be abandoned by developing.

SC 28Ms 29Dhs_28Phenomena whose root is to be abandoned neither by seeing nor by developing.

1.1.10. Triad on accumulation

SC 29Ms 29Dhs_29Msdiv 10Phenomena that lead to accumulation.

SC 30Ms 29Dhs_30Phenomena that lead to diminution.

SC 31Ms 29Dhs_31Phenomena that lead to neither accumulation nor diminution.

1.1.11. The “trainee” triad

SC 32Ms 29Dhs_32Msdiv 11Phenomena of the trainee.

SC 33Ms 29Dhs_33Phenomena of the adept.

SC 34Ms 29Dhs_34Phenomena neither of the trainee nor of the adept.

1.1.12. The “limited” triad

SC 35Ms 29Dhs_35Msdiv 12Phenomena that are limited.

SC 36Ms 29Dhs_36Phenomena that are extensive.

SC 37Ms 29Dhs_37Phenomena that are immeasurable.

1.1.13. The “limited object” triad

SC 38Ms 29Dhs_38Msdiv 13Phenomena whose object is limited.

SC 39Ms 29Dhs_39Phenomena whose object is extensive.

SC 40Ms 29Dhs_40Phenomena whose object is measureless.

1.1.14. The “inferior” triad

SC 41Ms 29Dhs_41Msdiv 14Phenomena that are inferior.

SC 42Ms 29Dhs_42Phenomena that are average.

SC 43Ms 29Dhs_43Phenomena that are superior.

1.1.15. The “fixed for a bad destiny” triad

SC 44Ms 29Dhs_44Msdiv 15Phenomena that are fixed for a bad destiny.

SC 45Ms 29Dhs_45Phenomena that are fixed for a good destiny.

SC 46Ms 29Dhs_46Phenomena that are not fixed.

1.1.16. The “ the path objects” triad

SC 47Ms 29Dhs_47Msdiv 16Phenomena that are the object of the path.

SC 48Ms 29Dhs_48Phenomena that are the root of the path.

SC 49Ms 29Dhs_49Phenomena that predominate the path.

1.1.17. The “arisen” triad

SC 50Ms 29Dhs_50Msdiv 17Phenomena that have arisen.

SC 51Ms 29Dhs_51Phenomena that have not arisen.

SC 52Ms 29Dhs_52Phenomena that are arising.

1.1.18. The “past” triad

SC 53Ms 29Dhs_53Msdiv 18Phenomena of the past.

SC 54Ms 29Dhs_54Phenomena of the future.

SC 55Ms 29Dhs_55Phenomena of the present.

1.1.19. The “past object” triad

SC 56Ms 29Dhs_56Msdiv 19Phenomena whose object is in the past.

SC 57Ms 29Dhs_57Phenomena whose object is in the future.

SC 58Ms 29Dhs_58Phenomena whose object is in the present.

1.1.20. The “internal” triad

SC 59Ms 29Dhs_59Msdiv 20Phenomena that are internal.

SC 60Ms 29Dhs_60Phenomena that are external.

SC 61Ms 29Dhs_61Phenomena that are internal and external.

1.1.21. The “internal object” triad

SC 62Ms 29Dhs_62Msdiv 21Phenomena whose object is internal.

SC 63Ms 29Dhs_63Phenomena whose object is external.

SC 64Ms 29Dhs_64Phenomena whose object is internal and external.

1.1.22. The “visible” triad

SC 65Ms 29Dhs_65Msdiv 22Phenomena that are visible and resistant.

SC 66Ms 29Dhs_66Phenomena that are invisible and resistant.

SC 67Ms 29Dhs_67Phenomena that are invisible and non-resistant.

SC 68Ms 29Dhs_68Matrix of triads.

Translation of the “Matrix of the Compendium of Phenomena” (Dhammasaṅgaṇī mātikā) for SuttaCentral by Bhikkhu Sujato, 2014.

Translated with reference to Bhikkhu Ānandajoti’s Abhidhammamātikā: The Matrix from the Abstract Teaching, which contains additional notes.

This translation fills a gap on SuttaCentral, since the C.A.F. Rhys Davids translation of the Dhammasaṅgaṇī does not contain the mātikā itself. However, there has been no attempt to maintain consistency with the Rhys Davids translation.
